visits.text: Allen Cays - observation of Bahamian rock iguanas (protected species, no feeding)
Small coves and beaches of Allen Cays

activities.text: Light snorkeling on sandy bottoms and seagrass beds around the anchorage
Scouting the return route to New Providence (weather and tides)

days_plan.itin_title: EXUMAS & NASSAU: THE TURQUOISE POSTCARD IN 8 DAYS

visits.text: Cocoplum Beach — sandbars and swimming on turquoise beach (low tide in the morning)
Exuma Point Beach — large beach and pier north of Great Exuma
Rokers Point — elevated viewpoints and long ocean beach
George Town dock — water taxi to Stocking Island
Stocking Island (Chat 'N' Chill beach) — shallow lagoon and rays visible near the shore
Monument Hill — viewpoint of turquoise hues
Ocean-side Beach (Atlantic coast of Stocking Island) — walking and swimming
Boat departure from Barraterre (north of Great Exuma) for a day of islets
Leaf/Allen's Cay — beach with endemic iguanas
Plane wreck (Norman's Cay) — snorkeling around the fuselage
Compass Cay — nurse shark observation around the docks
Pipe Creek Sandbar — sandbar in the middle of crystal-clear waters
Big Major Cay (Pig Beach) — famous beach for its swimming pigs
Thunderball Grotto (Staniel Cay) — iconic cave for snorkeling
Staniel Cay Dock & village — stop at the dock and short walk
Hoopers Bay — sheltered beach, sea turtle observation
Jolly Hall Beach — calm cove near George Town
Rolle Town — panoramic views of the lagoon with intense hues
Tropic of Cancer Beach (Little Exuma) — long light sand beach
Salt Beacon (near Williams Town) — former salt marsh landmark

activities.text: Swimming and walking on sandbars at Cocoplum
Coastal walk and photos of blue hues (north Exuma)
Water taxi crossing George Town ⇄ Stocking Island (~15 min per trip)
Light snorkeling from the beach (weather permitting)
Short hike between beaches via ridge trails
Full-day speedboat excursion in the Exuma Cays (~8 hours door-to-door)
Snorkeling (wreck + cave), photo stops and swimming on sandbars
Swimming and beach-hopping on the south coast of Great Exuma and Little Exuma
Photo stops at high points and promontories

visits.text: Straw Market — colorful building and local crafts (exterior & hall)
Prince George Wharf — waterfront and view of cruise ships
Bay Street — shopping streets and pastel facades
Arawak Cay (Fish Fry) — waterfront promenade
Queen's Staircase — historic staircase carved into the rock (66 steps)
Fort Fincastle — bastion overlooking Nassau
Paradise Island Bridge View — passage to Paradise Island and view of the harbor
Western Esplanade Beach — urban beach for a final swim

activities.text: Urban walking tour in Nassau (historic center and waterfront)
Walking across the bridge to Paradise Island (round trip)

visits.text: Discovery of Nassau Downtown (Bay Street, Parliament Square)
Queen's Staircase and Fort Fincastle
Atlantis - The Dig (large aquarium) on Paradise Island
Paradise Island - beaches and walkways (view of the entrance channels)
Nassau Straw Market and walks through the historic districts

activities.text: Beach walk at Nassau port entrance and maritime traffic observation
Preparation for navigation to the Exumas (weather window, tides, routes)
Observation of large ships at the port entrance (from the beach or pier)
Last swim on the beach at the port entrance
